attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCC8zXWnXUzinvvkxqo_description
attribs.current:
Make a token on http://rolladvantage.com/tokenstamp/ upload the token as your character image, and change the character name with this format:

PC Name (Game ID)

This is so the character can be assigned to you and a token can be made even while you are offline. if you fail to follow these instructions the character will eventually get deleted.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIJrN9jSwrZHU0DqOZG_description
attribs.current:
Redwood Biome

Redwood -

Your other racial abilities are also altered by your redwood biome.

Redwood Settling deep from civilization and relying on ancient redwoods for reproduction, this stout wood has worked its way into the sinew of your body. Redwood variant Rootani increase their Strength score by 1.

Darkvision - You can see in dim light within 60 FT as though it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can not discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Tough Skin - When you reach 7th level, you can cast the Bark Skin spell (at it lowest level) twice with this trait witohut expending any spell slots. When cast through this racial ability, This spell can be cast on 2 sepperate creatures as it does not require concentration, and you regain both charges of this ability when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability modifier for this spell.

Splintering: When you are in combat, your innate fury channels the spirits of your massacred ancestors. As a reaction, If you have taken damage within the last turn and you hit an oponent with a melee attack, you may add 1d4 magical piercing damage to your damage roll. This damage adds 1d4 at 5th, 11th, and 17th level simmilar to cantrip progression.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIJrZ3lBTNrHPcCbknn_description
attribs.current:
Your Rootani character has certain characteristics derived from your plantlike heritage, and some of these traits vary depending on where your ancestors ended up after the great genocide and pilgrimage.

Ability Score Increases - Your Wisdom score increases by 2. One other ability score increases depending on the biome your subtype of rootani is from.

Age - A Rootani pod will sprout into a full gown adult in just a few days, but this pod takes about a decade to gestate. Once the pod hatches, the Rootani has only about 40 years before they will begin to feel the enfeebling sickness of age begin to take them.

Allignment - Most Rootani are neutral or good, with a strong pull towards chaotic.

Size - Rootani usually stand between 4 and 6 feet tall with stout or limber but dense builds. Your size is medium.

Speed - Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Roots of the past - Gain proficency in one of the following skills of your choice: Arcana, History, Nature, Religion

Languages - You can speak, read, and write common and sylvan.

Type - You are of the plant type. Your anatomy is too complex for the spell Regenerate plants from Book of Lost Spells to work on you. You must seek healing through traditional methods humanoids would use. You have a thick amber sap in the place of blood.

Pod-born though you enter a state of dormancy during long rests similiar to the way other creatures sleep, you are immune to any effect that would put you to sleep.

Rooted Culture At level 3 you gain access to the Druidcraft Cantrip.

Subracial Abilities - You also gain some abilities depending on the subrace of Rootani you sprout as. You are born when you sprout as this subspecies and it can not be changed except through the means of a wish spell.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LIK-BbCcYsph1zYkhw6_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LIK-BbCcYsph1zYkhw6_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 80/320

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIK-ZnjojeVVKzFZ38U_description
attribs.current:
-Advantage on Wis(Survival) checks to track Fey, Fiends, and Undead.
-Advantage on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.
-If you are actively tracking one of these creatures you can not be surprised by any creatures of that type. You can only track one type of creature at a time.
-At lvl 11 you can flare the internal toxic scars from the ritual, using the pain to give clarity or to promote anger you can choose to suffer damage equal to a roll of crimson rite damage die to gain advantage on a Wis(insight) check or Cha(Intimidation) check.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIK4lEfDr8g4P3o6LNR_description
attribs.current:
At lvl 1 you learn to invoke a rite of blood magic within your weapon at the cost of your own vitality choose to learn one right from the Primal Rites list. As a bonus action you can imbue a single weapon with the elemental energy of a known rite until your next short or long rest. While active attacks from this weapon deal an additional 1d4 rite damage of the chosen elemental type and is considered magical damage. If you lose the grip on your weapon the rite fades immediately. An active rite on a weapon thron fades directly after the attack is complete. Upon activating the rite you take damage up to your level of bloodhunter which reduces your maximum overall health by your blood hunter level. The max is regained when the rite fades but not the hit points. Crimson rite can be used on multiple weapons for additional hit point losses. Most weapons can only be subject to a single rite. Each end of a pole arm or quarter staff can be imbued with a blood rite. The rite can be dropped by the blood hunter at any time as a free action. 

Primal Rites: 1d4
RITE OF FLAME:  fire damage
RITE OF FROST:  cold damage
RITE OF STORM: lightning dmg

Esoteric Rites: 1d4
RITE OF ROAR: thunder damage
RITE OF ORACLE: psychic damage
RITE OF DEAD: necrotic damage

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current: I begin or end my day with small traditional rituals that are unfamiliar to those around me. I have my own ideas about what is and is not food, and I find the eating habits of those around me fascinating, confusing, or revolting.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Suspicious. I must be careful, for I have no way of telling friend from foe here. Cunning. Though I may not know their ways, neither do they know mine, which can be to my advantage.

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: Though I had no choice, I lament having to leave my beloved forest behind. I hope to see the ancestor trees again one day.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: I am convinced of the superiority of my own culture over that of this foreign land.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIKDzgi3IAjiZfnHelY_description
attribs.current: Great Weapon Fighting: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a non-rite damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. the weapon must have the two handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIKEZrt2EbjVP4pia-v_description
attribs.current:
You gain further knkowledge to channel and sacrifice a part of your vital essence to curse and manipulate your enemies. You gain one blood curse of your choice from below. At 9th, 13th, 16th and 20th level you gain another curse.
While invoking a blood curse but before it affects the target, you may choose to amplify the curse by suffering damage equal to a roll of your crimson rite damage. An amplified curse gains an additional effect, noted in the curse's description.
You can use blood maledict once between rests, at 6th level you can use it 2x, 11th 3x, 17 4x.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIKJY3m18gn4458MnWH_description
attribs.current:
Blood Curse of binding:
As a bonus action you can attempt to bind an enemy no more than one size larger than you within 30 ft. The target must succeed a strenth saving throw DC = 8+Prof+Wis mod. or have their speed reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn.
If amplified this curse becomes ongoing and can affect a creature regardless of their size. At the end of each turn it must make another strength saving throw On a success the curse ends. The bloodhunter can end the curse with a free action at any time.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIKJcbDN4L2LkwJK2d7_description
attribs.current:
1 Enemy with in 60 ft makes an attack, use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

If amplified the next attack the enemy has also has disadvantage.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIKK6HPe0185K4ZWTvR_description
attribs.current:
The moment a creature falls unconscious or dies within 30 ft of you you can use your reaction to give the creature a final act of aggression. That creature immediately makes a single weapon attack against  a target of your choice within its attack range. After the attack the creature returns to the state it was in.

If amplified you grant a bonus to the attack roll and damage roll equal to your Wis mod+Prof.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIKLeGys8u-3-0xQNAI_description
attribs.current:
When an enemy casts a spell that requires a Dex saving throw you can use your reaction to deflect the spell with your crimson rite. you gain a bonus to the initial saving throw against that spell equal to your Wis mod. This curse is invoked before before the saving throw is rolled. 

If amplified you grant all allies with in 5 ft of you this bonus to their saving throw against the triggered spell as well.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIKNCjNdC1vDspmM8oZ_description
attribs.current:
As a bonus action you can link to a creature within 30 ft for up a minute or 9 initiative rounds forcing them to share in the pain they inflict upon you. The next time the cursed creature damages you with a weapon attack, this curse deals necrotic damage to the cursed creature equal to half of the damage you suffered. This curse ends at that time.

If amplified This curse instead deals damage equal to the damage you suffered and it ignores necrotic resistance.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIKP6tiKJncD4sfUcgz_description
attribs.current:
As a bonus action you can mark an enemy with in 60 ft. Until the end of your turn, all crimson rite damage you deal to the target is doubled. 

If amplified you cause the marked target to also lose resistance to your rite damage type until the beginning of your next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIKQYZR9YIdyq06bFxr_description
attribs.current:
As a bonus action you can manipulate the vitality of a creature within 60 ft to  expunge a corruption in their blood. The target creature can immediately make a saving throw against a poisoned condition afflicting it. 

If amplified your target can instead immediately make a saving throw against one other condition afflicting it. This condition can be blinded, deafened or paralyzed.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIKSEc4XBIxrErqVkFa_description
attribs.current:
When an enemy casts a spell within 60 ft that requires a spell attack roll and targets you, you can use your reaction to rend the spell from the air, imposing disadvantage on the spell attack roll.

If amplified you make a Wis ability check. The DC equals 10+ the spells level. On a success the creature's spell misses you automatically.

attribs.name: character_appearance
attribs.current: An uprooted Redwood Sprout that seems to have a glowing yellow aura.

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current: The mountain ranges on the far side of twill were burned by an infernal horde. Many of the creatures in the forest escaped including Deae a redwood rootani. Vowing vengeance Deae absorbed a cursed object that the trees had concealed for centuries a Talisman of Araumycos. To the redwood rootani this would be like praying to the mindflayers. After a week laying in the cave outside of twill, the first safe haven she could find, Deae awoke her eyes now glowing faintly yellow and blinded by rage. She has made it to the guild of the eternal sword to start her long quest.

attribs.name: additional_feature_and_traits
attribs.current: Deep within her bark is a talisman of Araumycos. It has been fused with the center of her being.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-LIKZu1gtKj3JM4huWMS_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target’s skin has a rough, bark-like appearance, and the target’s AC can’t be less than 16, regardless of what kind of armor it is wearing.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIrMJ2NjT3H71rrmBdY_description
attribs.current:
Order of the Lycan
Of the many terrible curses that plague the realm, few are as ancient or as feared as Lycanthropy. Passed through blood, this affliction seeds a host with the savage strength and hunger for violence of a wild beast. Those that shun the curse spend their lives burying their wild, bestial urges deep inside. However, the power of a rising full moon makes the curse tee strong to resist, and the host transforms into a terrifying animal—humanoid hybrid controlled by murderous impulse. These that embrace the dark nature of their curse learn to harness their bestial gifts, but also succumb to the evil, vicious temperament that drives the beast within.

The Order of the Lycan is a proud order of blood hunters who undergo “The Taming”, a ceremonial inflicting of lycanthropy from a senior member. These hunters then use their abilities to harness the power of the monster they harbor without losing themselves to it. Through intense honing of one’s own willpower, combined with the secrets of the order’s blood magic rituals, members learn to control and unleash their hybrid form fer short periods of time. Enhanced physical prowess, unnatural resilience, and razer sharp claws make these warriors a terrible foe to any evil that crosses their path. Yet, no training is perfect, and without care and complete focus, even the greatest of blood hunters can temporarily lose themselves to the bloodlust.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIrMeiLAoPwXXT0C26K_description
attribs.current:
Heightened Senses
Starting when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you begin to adopt the improved abilities of a natural predator. You gain advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LIrMor8kbtormpYnx1U_description
attribs.current:
Upon choosing this archetype at 3rd level, you begin to learn to control the lycanthropic curse that now lives in your blood. As an action, you can transform into your Hybrid form. This form lasts for 10 minutes. You can speak, use equipment, and wear armor in this form. You can revert to your normal form earlier by using an action on your turn. You automatically revert to your normal form if you fall unconscious, drop to 0 hit points, or die. The benefits of this form replace the rules for Lycanthropy within the Monsters Manual.
Feral Might. You gain a bonus to melee damage rolls equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down). You also have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
Resilient Hide. You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren’t silvered. While you are not wearing heavy armor, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC.
Predatory Strikes. Your unarmed strikes are considered a single weapon in regards to your crimson rite feature. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes. When you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike, you can make another unarmed strike as a bonus action. Your unarmed strikes deal ld6 slashing damage. This die increases to ld8 at 11th level, and 1d10 18th level.
Cursed Weakness. Your have vulnerability to damage from silvered weapons.
Bloodlust. At the start of your turn, if you’ve taken any damage since the beginning of your last turn, you must make a Wisdom saving throw to maintain control. The DC equals 10, or half of the total damage you’ve taken from attacks since your last turn, whichever number is higher. On a failed save, you must move directly towards the nearest creature to you and use the Attack action against that creature. If there is more than one possible target, the DM chooses the target. You then regain control for the remainder of your turn.
If you are under an effect that prevents you from concentrating (like the Barbarian’s rage feature), you automatically fail this saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LVUqDMcsg3Ypu5lf0nY_itemcontent
attribs.current: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LYP37prQ4183FZ57WUI_description
attribs.current: When you reach 9th level, you can take 10 minutes to meditate on an object to discern vague details regarding any lingering evil or wicked past surrounding it. Make a Wisdom ability check. Based on the result, the DM may reveal obscure information about dark events that may have previously surrounded the object, or hints toward a sinister purpose. This feature has no effect on objects untouched by evil. An object can only be targeted by this feature once, and future attempts reveal no further details. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.
